sub_topic: Finding the area of a parallelogram.
message_1: A parallelogram has a base of 10 meters and a height of 6 meters. What is its area in square meters?
message_2:
The area of a parallelogram can be calculated using the formula:

Area = base × height

In this case, the base is 10 meters and the height is 6 meters. So, the area of the parallelogram is:

Area = 10 meters × 6 meters = 60 square meters
